Well yeah these two are some of my best... in my opinion anyways. Rate, hate, whatever. And if anyone wants a challenge... just PM me ;)

item.title: 2 most recent
item.dc:creator: @Immortal Immortal
item.description:
@Immortal wrote:

Sig* a render generally, but not always, refers to a single graphical image. Works like these are generally referred to as ‘sigs’ or ‘tags’ because they have an image and a background etc. in one form.
Thanks for comments

Read full topic

@Zigon wrote:

Not bad, 8/10. I like the Spiderman render.

Read full topic

item.title: 2 most recent
item.dc:creator: @Immortal Immortal
item.description:
@Immortal wrote:

Alexia, most people nowadays have their own style that they follow, and they don’t look exactly the same. The character or render should be centered if appropriate, as all good artists/gfx people use the center as a focal point for sigs and the center is usually the best place to have your render to increase the flow of your signature. Text is not visible because that’s how you use good text, you don’t have it standing out at size 72px, black saying ‘immortal’, you want to have it go with the flow of the signature and blend in with the background, like I have done.
The empty corners are about the only downfall of them, but I’m working on them, I might actually use some stock images as well as my render in my next.

@kaza - a tag refers to a small size of graphics. Sigs, tags, whatever, they both usually refer to smaller peices of graphics.

Thanks for CC anyways people.

Read full topic

item.title: 2 most recent
item.dc:creator: @usernamelol .Fusion
item.description:
@usernamelol wrote:

Erm? Actully when your using stocks you most of the time want to center to stock on the canvas. Text is always meant to blend, its not always wanting to stand out. And kaza, a tag is basicly a modified stock or you used a render that is popular and goes with the render.

Read full topic

item.title: 2 most recent
item.dc:creator: @alexia alexia
item.description:
@alexia wrote:

  1. They are too similar. If you keep making signatures look exactly the same, people will grow bored of them.

  2. The “character” of an image should never be centered. Put it at the left or right side. Any good photographer would tell you that.

  3. “Spiderman” in the top one is too hard to read, as is “Immortal” in the bottom one. Other than that, the text is pretty good.

  4. The upper corners are too bland. You have all this action in the whole signature, then just… nothing… in the corners. The top one does better with this, but still… the fading takes away from the effect of the signature.

Ratings:
Top - 9.1/10
Bottom - 8.7/10

-Alexia

Read full topic

item.description:
@kaza wrote:

nice, i like them, good work 9/10.

Although i wouldnt really call them tagz, thats to do with grafiti or somthing, tag as in your name you put everywere when you do it. eg- ‘I just tagged that bus stop, aint i hard woooo’
